alert.note: Alert for Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Hurricane Local Statement issued July 02 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: This product covers southeast North Carolina and northeast South Carolina Tropical Storm Colin to bring minimal impacts to the Southeastern North Carolina Beaches NEW INFORMATION --------------- * CHANGES TO WATCHES AND WARNINGS: - The Tropical Storm Warning has been cancelled for Coastal Brunswick * CURRENT WATCHES AND WARNINGS: - A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for Coastal New Hanover and Coastal Pender * STORM INFORMATION: - About 50 miles west-southwest of Wilmington NC or about 30 miles northeast of Myrtle Beach SC - 34.0N 78.6W - Storm Intensity 40 mph - Movement Northeast or 45 degrees at 7 mph SITUATION OVERVIEW ------------------ The center of Tropical Storm Colin will pass near Cape Fear tonight and move away from North Carolina on Sunday. The main impacts remain limited to the coastal waters and beaches, with strong rip currents expected at some local beaches. POTENTIAL IMPACTS ----------------- * WIND: Little to no impacts are anticipated at this time across southeast North Carolina. * FLOODING RAIN: Little to no impacts are anticipated at this time across southeast North Carolina. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS ---------------------------------- Visitors in the area should listen for the name of the city and county in which you are staying for local news updates. Pay attention for instructions from local authorities. * ADDITIONAL SOURCES OF INFORMATION: - For information on appropriate preparations see ready.gov - For information on creating an emergency plan see getagameplan.org - For additional disaster preparedness information see redcross.org NEXT UPDATE ----------- The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Wilmington NC around 8 PM EDT, or sooner if conditions warrant.
